> > J2EE is way (waayy) more complicated than SOAP;
=
> > EJB+Servlets+JDBC+JAAS+RMI-IIOP+JNDI+JMS...

> That's because it's doi=
ng different things.

Sure, but that's what J2EE is according to Sun. A big=
 beast.


> I wouldn't include IIOP (from Corba) or RMI (from Java) - 
> op=
tional & usually available but not required in J2EE.

Yep, but the interop =
standard for EJB is RMI-IIOP, not RMI; historically
that was invented to ke=
ep the CORBA crowd happy. And it's essence is
synchronous, RPC and pass by =
value. I honestly don't know how well the
stubs and skeletons thing fits wi=
th REST, but otherwise RMI-IIOP doesn't
strike me as a RESTful protocol.

 =

> JAAS is probably just as 
> core - I just don't happen to have any exper=
ience with it.

JAAS looks nice, it does much the same for authentication a=
nd
authorization that JNDI does for directories and JDBC does for
datasourc=
es. Clients can declare controls impendent of implementations.
I wanted to =
use it an upcoming project, but I didn't think there was
time for me to pic=
k it up properly.
